    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseConnection

        public DatabaseConnection(java.lang.String driver,
                          java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String userId,
                          java.lang.String password)
        Constructs a database connection with the supplied connection information.
        Parameters:
        driver - The JDBC driver to load
        url - The database endpoint URL
        userId - The database user id
        password - The database password
        See Also:
        testConnection(), closeStatement(Statement)

    • Method Detail

      • setupPreparedStatement

        public java.sql.PreparedStatement setupPreparedStatement(java.lang.String sql)
        Setup a prepared statement. If a database query is to be executed this method should be called, passing a parameterized SQL statement. The caller should then set the parameters (if any) before calling the runQuery or runUpdate method. Note that it is the callers job to assure the statement is closed. This normally happens after processing a result set or when and update is executed. See the runQuery and runUpdate documentation for details on closing the statement.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL statement with optional parameters
        Returns:
        A parameterized statement based on the supplied SQL
        See Also:
        runQuery(PreparedStatement), runUpdate(PreparedStatement)

      • runQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet runQuery(java.sql.PreparedStatement stmt)
        Run the query defined by the prepared statement. Before calling this method the caller should have used the setupPreparedStatement method to create a prepared statement. After the caller is finished with the resultset it should use the closeResultSet method to clean up the database resources.
        Parameters:
        stmt - The prepared statement with any parameters defined
        Returns:
        The result set from the database
        See Also:
        setupPreparedStatement(String), closeResultSet(ResultSet)

      • runUpdate

        public void runUpdate(java.sql.PreparedStatement stmt)
        Run the update statement (e.g. SQL statement that does not return a result set). Before calling this method the caller should have used the setupPreparedStatement method to create a prepared statement. The underlying statement and connection are automatically closed when this method is called.
        Parameters:
        stmt - The prepared statement with any parameters defined return The return code from the backend
        See Also:
        setupPreparedStatement(String)

      • closeResultSet

        public void closeResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        Clean up the database resources for a result set. Callers should use this once they are finished with the result set returned by the runQuery method. This method closes the result set as well as the underlying statement and database connection. There is no need to call closeStatement on the underlying statement if this method is used to close the result set.
        Parameters:
        rs - The result set returned by the runQuery method
        See Also:
        runQuery(PreparedStatement), closeStatement(Statement)

      • closeStatement

        public void closeStatement(java.sql.Statement stmt)
        Cleans up the resources for a statement. This closes the statement and database connection. This method should not be called using statements whose results sets have already been closed using closeResultSet.
        Parameters:
        stmt - The statement obtained by calling setupPreparedStatement
        See Also:
        setupPreparedStatement(String), closeResultSet(ResultSet)
